intro: Spathacanthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and stream banks. It is native to regions in southern Africa and is often found in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils. Spathacanthus parviflorus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
